intro: Alkanna leucantha, commonly known as the white alkanna, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Alkanna leucantha is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
